conclusion: To solve the problem, we need to determine the magnitude and direction of the frictional force acting on the wire frame at the moment t = 2.5 s.
The area of the part of the wire frame in the magnetic field is calculated as A = 0.02 m^2.
The magnetic induction intensity at t = 2.5 s is calculated as B = 8 T.
The magnetic flux Φ is expressed as Φ = B · A.
The rate of change of the magnetic flux is calculated as dΦ/dt = A · dB/dt.
The rate of change of the magnetic induction intensity is determined as dB/dt = 2 T/s.
The rate of change of the magnetic flux is calculated as dΦ/dt = 0.04 Wb/s.
The induced emf is calculated as ε = -0.04 V.
The current in the wire frame is calculated as I = -0.01 A.
The magnetic force on the wire frame is expressed as F = I · L × B.
The magnetic force on the wire frame is calculated as F = -0.016 N in the vertical direction.
